dt.t: the {wi}paradoxical{/wi} theory that global warming will lead to the next Ice Age

dt: {bc}not being the normal or usual kind

shortdef: of the nature of a paradox
not being the normal or usual kind

dt: {bc}a state of sleep that recurs cyclically with {d_link|non-REM sleep|non-REM sleep} several times during a normal period of sleep, is characterized especially by greatly depressed muscle tone, dreaming with vivid imagery, rapid eye movements, and increased neuronal activity in certain brain regions (such as the {d_link|pons|pons}), and typically comprises up to 25% of time spent in sleep

dt.t: {wi}REM sleep{/wi}, it soon became apparent, occurs in intervals throughout the night, usually four to six times, each lasting from ten minutes to an hour.
People awakened during {wi}REM sleep{/wi} usually report dreams with visual images and storylike narratives.

shortdef: a state of sleep that recurs cyclically with non-REM sleep several times during a normal period of sleep, is characterized especially by greatly depressed muscle tone, dreaming with vivid imagery, rapid eye movements, and increased neuronal activity in certain brain regions (such as the pons), and typically comprises up to 25% of time spent in sleep —called also paradoxical sleep, rapid eye movement sleep
